DataElement.preferredName: Person QTcB Prolongation Greater Than 500 msec Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Assessments Ind-3b
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/not applicable indicator whether a person has a history of QTc prolongation, a time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle longer than 500 msec, as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person QTcB Prolongation Greater Than 500 msec Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having a history of QTc prolongation, a time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle longer than 500 msec, as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: QTcB Prolongation Greater Than 500 msec Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Corrected QT interval longer than 500 msec, in accordance with Bazett's correction formula.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Corrected QT interval longer than 500 msec, in accordance with Bazett's correction formula.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history or family history of congenital long QTc syndrome

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the JTc interval been used in place of the QTc with sponsor approval?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1701 TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history or family history of congenital long QTc syndrome or drug-induced QTc prolongation?
